content.webTitle: US swing states: what is the state of play?

fields.headline: US swing states: what is the state of play?
fields.bodyText: Election Day was Tuesday. It’s Thursday and we still don’t know who the next president of the United States is going to be. Here’s how the key states are looking now … Arizona 11 electoral votes Called for Biden by AP and Fox News Biden leads 50.5-48.1, with 86% counted. Trump needs to win nearly two-thirds of the remaining votes Next update: not before 9pm ET on Thursday (2am GMT Friday) Georgia 16 electoral votes Toss-up Trump leads 49.6–49.1, with 95% counted Biden needs to win 60% of remaining votes Next update: Georgia’s secretary of state says they hope to have results on Thursday. The uncounted ballots include those from population-dense counties that lean Democratic. Biden is outperforming Hillary Clinton’s 2016 vote in those counties. Michigan 16 electoral votes Called for Biden Nevada Six electoral votes Toss-up but leans Biden Biden leads 49.3-48.7, with 86% counted The lead is fewer than 8,000 but remaining mail-in is expected to skew Democrat Next update: Result expected noon ET/5pm UK. Trump narrowly lost Nevada in 2016 as the state has trended toward the Democrats in the past decade. North Carolina 15 electoral votes Toss-up but leans Trump Trump leads 50.1-48.7, with 95% counted Biden needs two-thirds of mail-in ballots to go his way Next update: Mail ballots are still accepted if they arrive by 12 November, so there could be a long wait for certainty. Trump prematurely claimed early on Wednesday that he had won the state. There are up to 116,000 mail ballots left to count. Pennsylvania 20 electoral votes Toss-up Trump leads 50.7-48.1, with 89% of the vote in Most votes yet to be counted are in strong Democrat urban areas Next update: Result expected on Friday, but already subject to Trump legal challenges over mail-in ballots being counted that are postmarked on election day or before but arrive after 3 November. Trump wants them tossed out. Wisconsin 10 electoral votes Called for Biden Biden’s lead is 49.4-48.8 Associated Press contributed to the reporting in this article
